model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: I have been relaxing with the kids as much as I have. My husband has been busy with work, so we haven't had time for anything big. I would love to visit Italy some day though if we get the chance. Have you ever been to Italy before?

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A has seen the Disney movie 'Luca' recently.
2. Speaker B's kids enjoyed watching 'Luca' and said it was good.
3. Speaker B's husband enjoys Disney sports movies, such as 'Miracle'.
4. Speaker B's kids enjoy watching Disney movies, which Speaker B also finds good.
5. Speaker B enjoys watching movies with her kids.
6. Speaker A has booked a "Hawaii Sunset" tour for next month, being excited about it being their first time.

raw_prediction: No, I've never been to Italy before, but watching Luca definitely made me want to go. Hopefully, you'll get the chance to visit Italy in the future! Until then, I'm really looking forward to my Hawaii sunset tour. I'll be sure to share all the details with you when I get back!
